sen.j: 多々良浜の戦い（たたらはまのたたかい）は、南北朝時代 (日本)の1336年（建武 (日本)3年）に行われた合戦である。
sen.e: The Battle of Tatarahama was a battle in 1336 during the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties (Japan).
The Battle of Tatarahama was a battle in 1336 during the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties (Japan).
The Battle of Tatarahama was a battle in 1336 during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.j: 後醍醐天皇の建武の新政から離反した足利尊氏は、建武政権から尊氏追討を命じられた新田義貞を箱根・竹ノ下の戦いで破り、さらに新田軍を追撃して京都の確保を図るが、1336年、楠木正成や北畠顕家らと連絡した宮方勢に京都とその近辺で敗れ海路西走し、途中播磨国の赤松則村（円心）らに助けられ、再興を賭けて九州地方に下る。
sen.e: In the battle of Hakone-Takenoshita, Takauji ASHIKAGA defecting from the Kemmu Restoration by Emperor Go-Daigo defeated Yoshisada NITTA who had been ordered to crush Takauji by the Kemmu government; then, Takauji chased the Nitta's forces to capture Kyoto, but in 1336, he was defeated in and around Kyoto by the Imperial side which contacted with Masashige KUSUNOKI and Akiie KITABATAKE; he escaped to the west by ship towards Kyushu to rebuild his forces, helped by Norimura AKAMATU (Enshin) of Harima-no-kuni on the way.

At the battle of Hakone-Takenoshita, Takauji ASHIKAGA, who was defecting from the Kemmu Restoration by Emperor Go-Daigo, defeated Yoshisada NITTA who had been ordered to crush Takauji by the Kemmu government; then, Takauji chased Nitta's forces trying to capture Kyoto, but in 1336, he was defeated in and around Kyoto by the Imperial forces which had contact with Masashige KUSUNOKI and Akiie KITABATAKE; he escaped to the west, towards Kyushu, by ship to renew his forces, helped by Norimura AKAMATU (Enshin) of Harima-no-kuni on the way.

At the battle of Hakone-Takenoshita, Takauji ASHIKAGA, who was defecting from the Kemmu Restoration by Emperor Godaigo, defeated Yoshisada NITTA who had been ordered to crush Takauji by the Kemmu government; then, Takauji chased Nitta's forces trying to capture Kyoto, but in 1336, he was defeated in and around Kyoto by the Imperial forces which had contact with Masashige KUSUNOKI and Akiie KITABATAKE; he escaped to the west, towards Kyushu, by ship to renew his forces, helped by Norimura AKAMATU (Enshin) of Harima Province on the way.
sen.cmt: 名前の表記訂正しました。Harima-no-kuni→Harima Province

sen.j: 尊氏は、足利方に味方した肥前国守護の少弐頼尚らに迎えられる。
sen.e: Takauji was welcomed by the shugo of Hizen-no-kuni Yorinao SHONI and some other people who sided with the Ashikaga side.
Takauji was welcomed by the shugo of Hizen-no-kuni, Yorinao SHONI, and some other people who sided with Ashikaga.
Takauji was welcomed by the provincial governer of Hizen Province, Yorinao SHONI, and some other people who sided with Ashikaga.
sen.cmt: Hizen no kuni shugo (provincial governer of Hizen Province)

sen.j: 一方、宮方に味方した肥後国の菊池武敏をはじめ、筑前国の秋月種道、肥後国の阿蘇惟直、筑後国の蒲池武久、星野家能など、九州の諸豪族の大半は宮方に味方し、その軍勢は2万騎以上まで膨れ上がる。
sen.e: On the other hand, a large number of powerful clans in Kyushu, including Taketoshi KIKUCHI of Higo-no-kuni who had been on the Imperial side, Tanemichi AKIZUKI of Chikuzen-no-kuni, Korenao ASOKO of Higo-no-kuni, Takehisa KAMACHI and Ieyoshi HOSHINO (星野家能) of Chikugo-no-kuni, sided with the Imperial side, amounting to over 20, 000 cavalry.
sen.cmt: 星野家能→Ieyoshi HOSHINO (星野家能)[定訳不明]
sen.e: On the other hand, a large number of powerful clans in Kyushu, including Taketoshi KIKUCHI, of Higo-no-kuni who had been on the Imperial side, Tanemichi AKIZUKI of Chikuzen-no-kuni, Korenao ASO of Higo-no-kuni, Takehisa KAMACHI and Ieyoshi HOSHINO (星野家能) of Chikugo-no-kuni, all sided with the Imperial side, resulting in a force of over 20,000 cavalry.

On the other hand, a large number of powerful clans in Kyushu, including Taketoshi KIKUCHI, of Higo Province who had been on the Imperial side, Tanemichi AKIZUKI of Chikuzen Province, Korenao ASO of Higo Province, Takehisa KAMACHI and Ieyoshi HOSHINO of Chikugo Province, all sided with the Imperial side, resulting in a force of over 20,000 cavalry.
sen.cmt: Higo-no-kuni→Higo ProvinceChikuzen-no-kuni→Chikuzen Province星野家能は定訳不明ですが、仮訳とし、日本語は削除しました。

sen.j: 勢いを増した宮方(南朝方)の軍勢は博多を攻め、少弐氏の本拠大宰府を襲撃して陥落させ、少弐貞経を自害させる。
sen.e: Having momentum, the forces of the Imperial side (the nancho side, or Yoshino Imperial court) advanced to attack Hakata, and captured Dazaifu, headquarters of the Shoni clan, forcing Sadatsune SHONI to commit suicide.

Gaining momentum, the Imperial forces (the nancho side, or Yoshino Imperial court) advanced to attack Hakata, and captured Dazaifu, the headquarters of the Shoni clan, forcing Sadatsune SHONI to commit suicide.

Gaining momentum, the Imperial forces (the Southern Court side, or Yoshino Imperial court) advanced to attack Hakata, and captured Dazaifu, the headquarters of the Shoni clan, forcing Sadatsune SHONI to commit suicide.

sen.j: 足利勢は、筑前国宗像（現在の福岡県宗像市周辺）を本拠とする宗像氏範らの支援を受けて宗像大社に戦勝を祈願し、筑前国の多々良浜（福岡市東区 (福岡市)）に布陣した菊池氏率いる宮方と戦うが、足利軍は約2千騎に過ぎなかった。
sen.e: With the support from Ujinori MUNAKATA based in Munakata, Chikuzen-no-kuni (the present-day area around Munakata City in Fukuoka Prefecture), the Ashikaga side prayed for victory at the Munakata-taisya Shrine, and with only 2,000 cavalry, fought with the Imperial side led by the Kikuchi clan who set up a camp in Tatarahama, Chikuzen-no-kuni (.Higashi ward, Fukuoka City).

With support from Ujinori MUNAKATA, based in Munakata, Chikuzen-no-kuni (the present-day area around Munakata City in Fukuoka Prefecture), the Ashikaga side prayed for victory at the Munakata-taisya Shrine, and with only 2,000 cavalry, fought the Imperial forces led by the Kikuchi clan who set up camp in Tatarahama, Chikuzen-no-kuni (Higashi ward, Fukuoka City).

With support from Ujinori MUNAKATA, based in Munakata, Chikuzen Province (the present-day area around Munakata City in Fukuoka Prefecture), the Ashikaga side prayed for victory at the Munakata-taisha Shrine, and with only 2,000 cavalry, fought the Imperial forces led by the Kikuchi clan who set up camp in Tatarahama, Chikuzen Province (Higashi Ward, Fukuoka City).
sen.cmt: Chikuzen-no-kuni→Chikuzen Provincetaishaスペル訂正Ward大文字にしました。

sen.j: 兵力の差は歴然で、少弐貞経が足利軍のために調達した装備は菊池軍の大宰府攻撃の際に焼失していたため、当初は宮方の菊池軍が優勢であったが、菊池軍に大量の裏切りが出たため戦況は逆転し、菊池軍は総崩れで敗走し、阿蘇惟直は戦死する。
sen.e: The Kikuchi's forces of the Imperial side were superior at first because the Ashikaga forces were greatly outnumbered and the military equipment obtained by Sadatsune SHONI was destroyed by fire during the attack of Dazaifu; the situation, however, was reversed due to the betrayal of many warriors in the Kikuchi's forces: the Kikuchi's forces collapsed and fled, and in the meanwhile, Korenao ASOKO died in battle.

At first Kikuchi's forces on the Imperial side were superior because the Ashikaga forces were greatly outnumbered and the military equipment obtained by Sadatsune SHONI was destroyed by fire during the attack of Dazaifu; the situation, however, was reversed due to betrayal by many warriors in Kikuchi's forces: leading Kikuchi's forces to collapse and flee, and in the meantime, Korenao ASO died in battle.
sen.cmt: 表現を変更しました。（名前も修正しました）
sen.e: At first Kikuchi's forces on the Imperial side were superior because the Ashikaga forces were greatly outnumbered and the military equipment obtained by Sadatsune SHONI was destroyed by fire during the attack of Dazaifu; the situation, however, was reversed due to betrayal by many warriors in Kikuchi's forces: leading Kikuchi's forces to collapse and flee, and in the meantime, Korenao ASO died in battle.

sen.j: 多数の裏切りを出した背景には、九州の諸豪族を軒並み味方につけて大軍を組織してはいても、その大半は南朝方有利の情勢を見て是非なく菊池武敏に味方した者であったという事実が存在する。
sen.e: One reason for the betrayal of many warriors was that even though the Kikuchi's side led a large force allied with almost all the powerful clans in Kyushu, most of them regarded the nancho side as superior and opportunistically sided with Taketoshi KIKUCHI.

One reason for the betrayal by many warriors was that even though Kikuchi's side led a large force allied with almost all the powerful clans in Kyushu, most of them regarded the nancho side as superior and sided with Taketoshi KIKUCHI.

One reason for the betrayal by many warriors was that even though Kikuchi's side led a large force allied with almost all the powerful clans in Kyushu, most of them regarded the Southern Court side as superior and sided with Taketoshi KIKUCHI.

sen.j: 確かな南朝方と呼べるのは阿蘇惟直ぐらいで、その他のほとんどはもともと日和見、もしくはむしろ尊氏よりの武将達であった。
sen.e: Korenao ASOKO was the only one clearly on the side of the nancho while the other warriors were originally opportunistic or on the side of Takauji.
Korenao ASO was the only one clearly on the side of the nancho while the other warriors were opportunistic or on the side of Takauji.

sen.e: Korenao ASO was the only one clearly on the side of the Southern Court while the other warriors were opportunistic or on the side of Takauji.

sen.j: また、圧倒的に不利な状況であっても終始積極的な戦法を取り、一度南朝方に付いた者の寝返りを誘った尊氏の戦略も見逃せない。
sen.e: Additionally, Takauji's constant, proactive tactics even in a devastating situation played a major role in bringing about the betrayal of those who once sided with the nancho side.
Additionally, Takauji's constant, proactive tactics even in a devastating situation played a major role in bringing about the betrayal of those who once sided with the nancho side.
Additionally, Takauji's constant, proactive tactics even in a devastating situation played a major role in bringing about the betrayal of those who once sided with the Southern Court side.

sen.j: この戦いの結果により九州のほぼ全域が足利方につくこととなり、尊氏は体勢を整え直した。
sen.e: As a result of this battle, almost all the areas in Kyushu allied with the Ashikaga side, and Takauji succeeded in rebuilding his forces.
As a result of this battle, almost all the areas in Kyushu allied with the Ashikaga side, and Takauji succeeded in renewing his forces.
As a result of this battle, almost all the areas in Kyushu allied with the Ashikaga side, and Takauji succeeded in renewing his forces.

sen.j: 尊氏は一色範氏や仁木義長などを九州の抑えとして残して再び上洛し、摂津国湊川の戦いで新田義貞を破る。
sen.e: Takauji advanced to Kyoto again with Noriuji ISSHIKI and Yoshinaga NIKKI left behind for the protection of Kyushu, and defeated Yoshisada NITTA in the Battle of Minatogawa in Settsu-no-kuni.
Takauji advanced on Kyoto again, leaving Noriuji ISSHIKI and Yoshinaga NIKKI behind to protect Kyushu, and defeated Yoshisada NITTA in the Battle of Minatogawa in Settsu-no-kuni.
Takauji advanced on Kyoto again, leaving Noriuji ISSHIKI and Yoshinaga NIKI behind to protect Kyushu, and defeated Yoshisada NITTA in the Battle of Minatogawa in Settsu Province.
sen.cmt: NIKIに訂正しました。スペース補足。-no-kuni→Provinceに訂正しました。

sen.j: しかし、この戦いの後に中央で足利尊氏が室町幕府を開いた後も菊池氏は南朝方として頑強に抵抗を続け、さらに南朝の後醍醐天皇の皇子である懐良親王が伊予国の宇都宮貞泰と共に九州に上陸して幕府勢力と戦い、一時期九州は懐良親王率いる征西軍府の南朝方が圧倒的優位の地となる。
sen.e: After the battle, however, Takauji ASHIKAGA established the Muromachi Shogunate in the central government, but the Kikuchi clan as the nancho side continued to resist stubbornly; furthermore, Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi, an Imperial prince of Emperor Go-Daigo, along with Sadayasu UTSUNOMIYA of Iyo-no-kuni landed Kyushu to fight with the Shogunate side, and the nancho side led by Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi in the anti-western forces posts dominated Kyushu awhile.

However, after the battle, Takauji ASHIKAGA established the Muromachi Shogunate as the central government, but the Kikuchi clan continued to resist stubbornly as the nancho side; furthermore, Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi, an Imperial prince of Emperor Godaigo, along with Sadayasu UTSUNOMIYA of Iyo-no-kuni landed in Kyushu to fight the Shogunate side, and the nancho side led by Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi in the anti-western forces posts dominated Kyushu for a while.

However, after the battle, Takauji ASHIKAGA established the Muromachi Shogunate as the central government, but the Kikuchi clan continued to resist stubbornly as the Southern Court side; furthermore, Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi, an Imperial prince of Emperor Godaigo, along with Sadayasu UTSUNOMIYA of Iyo Province landed in Kyushu to fight the Shogunate side, and the Southern Court side led by Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi in the anti-western forces posts dominated Kyushu for a while.
sen.cmt: nancho→Southern Courtに訂正しました。-no-kuni→Provinceに訂正しました。

sen.j: のち、観応の擾乱で幕府に反抗した尊氏の庶子足利直冬が九州に来ると、九州は南朝・尊氏(幕府)・直冬の3勢力が鼎立することとなる。
sen.e: As Takauji's illegitimate child, Tadafuyu ASHIKAGA who revolted against the Shogunate in the Riot of the Kan'o period (観応の擾乱) entered Kyushu, Kyushu was divided by the three equal powers of the nancho, Takauji (the Shogunate), and Tadafuyu.

When Takauji's illegitimate child, Tadafuyu ASHIKAGA who revolted against the Shogunate in the Riots of the Kan'o period (観応の擾乱) entered Kyushu, it was divided among the three equal powers of the nancho, Takauji (the Shogunate), and Tadafuyu.

When Takauji's illegitimate child, Tadafuyu ASHIKAGA who revolted against the Shogunate in the Kanno Disturbance entered Kyushu, it was divided among the three equal powers of the Southern Court, Takauji (the Shogunate) and Tadafuyu.
sen.cmt: 観応の擾乱→Kanno Disturbanceとしました。nancho→Southern Courtに訂正しました。,削除。
